intro: Cyclophorus lanceolatus, commonly known as the lanceolate cyclophorus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, violet-colored flowers. Native to certain regions of South America, this plant thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features include a short, creeping stem and hairy foliage. The plant is often found in woodland areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
